snippet: The British government said on Wednesday that it planned to sell a majority stake in Royal Mail, the country’s postal service, and would give some shares free to workers.
abstract: British government says it plans to sell majority stake in Royal Mail, country’s postal service, and will give some shares free to workers; says initial public offering, which would be the biggest privatization in country since railroads 20 years ago, will proceed in London before end of March 2014.
lead_paragraph: The British government said on Wednesday that it planned to sell a majority stake in Royal Mail, the country’s postal service, and would give some shares free to workers.

headline.main: Britain Offers Its Proposal to Privatize Mail Service
headline.print_headline: Britain Offers Its Proposal To Privatize Mail Service
